Information: This herb most well known for its memory enhancing property. Brahmi tea that is made by brewing Brahmi leaves helps to manage cold, chest congestion and bronchitis by clearing out the mucus from the air passages which helps ease breathing.
Procedure:
Internal Consumption:Brahmi leaves can be consumed fresh or dried. They are often used to prepare herbal teas, infusions, or decoctions.

Drinking Brahmi tea or decoction is believed to improve memory, concentration, and overall cognitive function.

It is also used to alleviate stress, anxiety, and insomnia by promoting relaxation and reducing mental fatigue.

Medicinal Formulations:Brahmi leaves are used in various Ayurvedic formulations, such as Brahmi Ghrita (Brahmi-infused ghee) and Brahmi oil.

Brahmi Ghrita is believed to have rejuvenating properties and is used to promote mental clarity, enhance memory, and support overall brain health.

Brahmi oil is used for scalp massage to nourish the hair follicles, improve hair texture, and promote hair growth. It is also believed to have a calming effect on the mind.

External Application:Brahmi leaves can be crushed to extract their juice, which can be applied topically to the scalp to nourish the hair and promote scalp health.Brahmi oil can also be applied externally to the scalp to stimulate hair growth and improve hair quality.

Holistic Approach:In Ayurveda, Brahmi leaves are considered to be part of a holistic approach to enhancing mental and cognitive health. They are valued for their ability to support overall well-being and promote longevity.
